Posts.Title: Stage IV Bone Mets Treatment Help Romans8 TXGigi

Posts.Content: Romans8 wrote: I was diagnosed with mets to the bone on 12/3/10 after removing my 2.7 tumor with DCIS. I have taken all the tests MRI, PET, CAT, Bone, etc. The mets are extensive to the bones only, spine, pelvis, femur ribs. My doctor just started me with zometa last week but my zoladex has not been approved yet. I am still waiting and am getting frustrated. I complaine of numbess on my right lower mouth between the lips and jaw and now my onc is sending me for an MRI of the brain and neck. While at this time, we are still waiting for bone biopsy results. I am almost done with 10 session of rads to my spine and sacrum. Why is it taking for them so long to give me my treatment regiment. It seems like all I've done was test, test and test. HELP ME! I need your advise, do I have to switch oncologist or is she doing the right things? Dx 11/9/2010, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage IV Bone Mets Treatment Help Romans8 TXGigi

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 06:24AM Romans8 wrote: Thanks Cathy for the kind words. I will follow up on that zoladex, I wonder where the holdup is? Thank you and God bless you! I will keep this post updated.
Posts.Title: Stage IV Bone Mets Treatment Help Romans8 TXGigi

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2011 02:03PM Romans8 wrote: Thank y'all. Finally got my zoladex injected today. My brain MRI scan showed no brain mets, yeeey! My onc thinks my bone disease is aggressive so she is starting chemo next week with Taxol & Avastin. Has any of you used these? any bad side effects? This will go on for 3 months and I will then do hormonals. Just too much to absorb for now but you my cyber friends are the only ones who truly understand what I'm going through. Blessings to you all. Romans8
Posts.Title: Stage IV Bone Mets Treatment Help Romans8 TXGigi

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 08:35PM Romans8 wrote: Windy, It is normal to be scared and then suddenly it seems like your world has ended. When I was diagnosed in Nov 10, my life stopped, like I was in a daze for 2 months. My DH started crying and said that I stopped living my life without thinking of my family. I have accepted that I am stage IV but there are many women in here who are brave and are still living with stage 4. There is nothing we can do about it, the doctors don't control your life, go on and don't let the disease eat you up. You have to be strong and fight to live. Only God knows your expiration date. Hugs to you and I will be praying for you and your family.

Posts.Title: NED Today Romans8 bourscheid

Posts.Content: Romans8 wrote: I was diagnosed stage 4 on Nov 2010. Found out I had several bone mets, spine, ribs, sternum, hips, sacrum. I had radiation to my spine and then chemotherapy, taxol and avastin. Two months, later, I had difficulty breathing and found out that I had pneumonitis to my lungs due to radiation. I was hospitalized and doctor said I had 50% chance of dying. I was on treatment for pneumonitis and I lost weight. After chemo, I was on zometa and femara. After a year, saw slight progression on my right hip, so ONC changed meds to faslodex, xgeva and arimidex, which I am still taking to this day. My cancer markers never went beyong 164 and its down to 34. I had my scan last wednesday and found out I am NED. My back still hurts  due to a collapsed vertebrae and lesions are inactive. Praise the Lord! God is really faithful and merciful.  If any of you have this kind, is it possible for me to have back surgery to repair the collapsed vertebrae? Thank you all for your help. I have been drinking soursop juice. Dx 11/9/2010, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 11:11AM Romans8 wrote: Hi Wwaterlily. Hugs for you. I am so sorry that you are dealing with this at a very young age. Do not lose hope as there are several here who has survived the disease for years. I too have bone mets all over, and my oncologist gave me 10 sessions of radiation that eased the pain. Currently, I am going through chemo. Talk to your onc about your situation, I am sure they can do a lot for you since you are very young. You've come to the right place, lots of women here will encourage you! God bless you!
Posts.Title: 28 YR Old Is Looking For Support from You wwaterlilyy ibcmets

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 09:53AM Romans8 wrote: Amoronto: Yes, there are several women who lived longer on stage IV but survival is not an option as this point. Everyone is not guaranteed to live forever. The disease is incurable but treatable. If your tx is working for now, then live with the present. When it comes to a point where it does not work and has to be changed, then you make your decision then when that time comes. Living in fear on what the future may hold or holds will make you depressed, scared, and angry. Live on a day by day basis and make the most out of it. You can go to a counselor; but you can hear from a lot of stage IV women here who continue to live and tell their daily struggles with this disease. Hugs to you and God bless you!

Posts.Title: Mastectomy at stage IV? Romans8 ibcmets

Posts.Content: Romans8 wrote: Helllo Ladies, I was diagnosed stage 4 from the get go with  mets to my bones (spine, femur, ribs, etc). I went through chemo and radiation and is now on femara and zometa since April this year. My last scan in September showed I am stable and my mammogram last week showed clear in both breasts. I am going to see my onco in 3 weeks and was just wondering if a mastectomy would make sense at this point. I only had lumpectomy on my right breast which they removed a 2.7 cm lump. Please advise dear sisters. Thank you!  Dx 11/9/2010, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mastectomy at stage IV? Romans8 ibcmets

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 12:57PM - edited Nov 30, 2011 01:09PM by Romans8 Hi! My name is Carly and I was diagnosed 11/9/10 stage IV mets to my bones - spine, femur, pelvis, ribs. I had chemo (taxol & avastin) and 10 sessions of rads. I also had my ovaries and fallopian tubes removed since I am ER+.  Am now stable on femara and zometa for the last 10 months, I still have back pain but not as bad.  I do not post on this site much but visit it everyday to read inspirational stories and life experiences  as a result of this disease. It is not easy but I get comforted that there are many of you out there who give hope to what we are going through. I laugh and cry with y'all. I pray that someday, a cure will be found and no one would suffer through this anymore. Enough for the awareness, its time for a CURE.

Posts.Title: when do you know? jleigh cookie97

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2012 06:37PM Romans8 wrote: Hi, I had radiation and chemo. Two months after radiation, I had shortness of breath and passed out while on vacation. Came home with an oxygen tank and was in hospital for 3 days. They diagnosed penuomonitis due to radidation. Doctors did lots of test to check for infection but could not find one. They gave me bactrim (500 mg) for 5 weeks with prednisone for 6 months. First 6 weeks of prednisone was 70 mg, then they tapered it to 50,30, 20, 10 & 5 mg towards the end of 6 months. It was gone after six months and I'm breathing good. Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Radiation Pneumonitis cmward23 Romans8
